name: vscode-brautomationtools
description: Tools to edit B&R Automation Studio projects in VS Code

commands.title: Update installed AS versions information from AS install paths

vscode-brautomationtools.test1.urlForHel.description: Where I got all this info

enumDescriptions: Build for creation of CF card

vscode-brautomationtools.environment.aut.description: Paths where the Automation Studio was installed. E.g. if AS is installed in C:\BrAutomation\AS46, the install path is C:\BrAutomation

asProjectFile.description: The (absolute?) path of the Automation Studio project file, e.g. 'C:\projects\MyFirstProject\MyFirstProject.apj'. If not set, the first .apj file in the workspace will be used.

asBuildMode.description: The build mode for this task. If set to "$dialog", a selection needs to be made on each execution

asConfiguration.description: The AS configuration which will be built. If set to "$dialog", a selection needs to be made on each execution

buildForSimulation.description: Always build project for ArSim target. If not set or set to false, the setting of the Automation Studio project configuration is used

buildRUCPackage.description: Always create RUC package. If not set or set to false, the setting of the Automation Studio project configuration is used

buildCrossReferences.description: Build only cross reference and header files. If set to true, no binaries are created

cleanGenerated.description: Cleans all generated .h and .a files. ATTENTION this affects all configurations!

additionalArguments.description: Additional arguments for Br.As.Build.exe. Write each argument as a separate array element, as strings with whitespaces get automatically quoted. For the same reason e.g. paths with whitespaces do not need to be quoted manually

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
